Currently the only way in is via road. The LRT (Light Rapid Transit) extension plan is yet to be executed, but once the system in extended, then Puchong will be accessible by LRT from Kuala Lumpur.

From Kuala Lumpur the easiest and toll-free way will be via Jalan Klang Lama or through Bukit Jalil which will lead to Bandar Kinrara (a township in Puchong).
If coming from Putrajaya, then you will have to use the LDP (Lebuh Raya Damansara Puchong) and pay RM1.60 for toll. Puchong is also accessible from Shah Alam by KESAS highway and Subang Jaya by LDP via Bandar Sunway. Both ways requires payment.

Puchong is easily accessible by car. You will need to have a valid driving license to drive and you will drive on left side of the road. The backbone of the Puchong is LDP, if you are going around within Puchong you will definitely need to use LDP. Within Puchong, there is no need to pay toll on the highway and there are many entrances and exits along it.
As in other parts of Klang Valley, there are metered taxis, but sometimes you will have to negotiate the price before starting the journey.
Puchong is served by Rapid KL and Metro bus. You might find some mini buses as well. It is recommended to use Rapid KL. Metro bus drivers are rude and their buses are very poorly maintained.
Currently the extension of LRT (Ampang Line) is carried out. Once it is completed, getting around Puchong will be a breeze.

value: content=This foodcourt has almost all the food famous in Malaysia, but located right there all in one place. Try the jumbo size fruit juice.
content=Variety of fruit juices, local hot drinks and beer available at foodcourts.
